data.title: Best breakfasts
data.text: The Pacific Street Cafe is our favorite for breakfast. The decore is fun with a model train that runs along a shelf just below the ceiling. Portions are large and everything is very good. Their cinnamon roll French toast is just the yummiest. Mark's Mess is also amazing. Named after the chef and a perfect combination of eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, cheese, potatoes, bell peppers and onions scrambled together.

data.title: Atmosphere and great food & service too
data.text: We have been going here for more years than I can remember.  We like being in a small town atmosphere since both my wife and I grew up in small towns.  Since I love trains, being next to the Union Pacific yards is an added bonus.  We go here mostly for a great breakfast meal on Saturdays, but we have enjoyed lunch on occasion too. Everything we have ever ordered has been outstanding and the wait-staff is always friendly, helpful, and accommodating.  Now, what more can you ask for.  I recommend this place to anyone and everyone at any time A+

data.title: Great Little Cafe
data.text: Stopped here for breakfast to fuel up before a big hike & this place was great.  Nice train atmosphere.  Located near the Union Pacific tracks this place honors that history.  There is a cute air whistle you can pull when you enter.  There is a model train track running throughout the restaurant (I'm told they change the trains often for various themes).  The food was very good.  Service very good.  Price about what you would expect.  I'd love to go back for lunch

data.title: Very cute
data.text: This little restaurant is very cute. The food was good and so was the service. They weren't busy at all so there was no wait to sit. The food was a little cold but the flavor was good.

data.title: Church Breakfast
data.text:
Several couples usually hit this place after church on Sundays.  Food is always
excellent and great service too.  Plus we love to "toot the horn".

data.title: Local favorite, but why?
data.text:
Pros: inexpensive, cool location
Cons: stuffy interior, mediocre food

This place is considered a local favorite for brunch, but I honestly can't figure out why... I have visited several times and no matter what, I am left disappointed. The food is average at best, comparable with Denny's (but not as good as Mel's). 

The interior of the restaurant is... odd. The weird semi-victorian theme with the cherubs and fake plants just feels outdated--like I'm sitting in an elderly woman's living room. The model train that runs around the top of the restaurant is sort of cool though. Overall, I think this place is most popular with the seniors in town.

data.title: Best breakfast in old historic Roseville
data.text: Great food...interesting décor...good service...great place to stroll old Roseville next to the original railroad depot and other shops

data.title: Wonderful local character of railroad culture
data.text: Great place and friendly staff able to get us in on any busy weekend morning.  Good selection of food for breakfast and lunch.

data.title: Great food and great service.
data.text: The food is consistently very good.  The waite staff are all very friendly and give excellent service

data.title: Great place for breakfast
data.text: This is a cute restaurant with a railroad theme (model trains run along the walls, there is a train whistle you can pull near the entrance, and it's located right next to the train tracks).  Food is good and service is excellent.  Nice people working here.  It's a hidden little gem in old Roseville.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: Love going to this restaurant for breakfast. Delicious food and really nice service. It's nice to take little children as they have a train going around the top of and through the walls. Will definitely go again.

data.title: Local Favorite
data.text: We don't get to the Pacific Street Cafe often enough.  It's a local favorite for anyone who knows its location in old Roseville near the railroad tracks.  The food is delicious and plentiful with quick and warmly provided service in a rustc / historic setting.  The site is the former City Hall established in 1906 before it burned down years later.  Now  all restored and expanded, the current site of PSC offers a pleasant environment for breakfast or lunch.

data.title: Delicious Breakfasts
data.text:
This is a somewhat difficult place to find your first time there and sometimes it's not easy to find a parking place because many businesses share the same parking lots. That being said, their breakfasts are delicious, especially their "South of the Border" omelet. They have a nice variety of entrees to select from for lunch, which are all very good.  My husband and I enjoy a cup of coffee with our breakfasts, but their coffee is so very weak that it has no taste.  They used to serve good coffee a few years ago, but something drastic has changed.  The next time we go there we will pick up a cup of coffee and bring in with us.

The servers are all very nice, friendly and efficient.

data.title: Good Breakfast - good price
data.text: Not a gourmet heaven but a very good breakfast at a decent price with good service.  Can't say a lot about the ambiance but its fine for a casual place.  Parking is available making it an easy in and out.  Good choices for breakfast with all the standards and we were greeted upon entry (I hate to be ignored) and coffee mugs were kept full and breakfast was served quickly and was hot and good.  Only minor negative is that where people are mostly seated in the AM has the worse viewing of the train that circles the restaurant.

data.title: awesome food and service
data.text: Sometimes it is difficult to please everyone in a group ranging from great grandma to our 8 year old grand daughter. Mission accomplished. They have a senior menu with good choices, either for breakfast or lunch, and a decent kids menu.

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: Cozy place, wonderful breakfasts. Servings are large and well prepared, service is friendly, prices are right

data.title: great place for family and especially for your kids who love trains
data.text: Friendly, good menu for breakfast, you kids 6 and under love the train box and real trains coming by often

data.title: Good food, fun atmosphere,  very popular
data.text: We have Sunday morning breakfast here every 4-5 weeks. Train themed restaurant. Great omelets, pancakes...biggest slab of ham for your ham and eggs.  Old historic building inside & out.  Across street from railroad tracks, mostly work trains...fun for the kids.  They also have a model train running around the rooms high enough so kids cant touch, but can still watch....also train whistle to toot at the front door.  Have room for large groups of people.  The service is always excellent, portions generous

data.title: Excellent food, family run, lots of trains nearby
data.text: Been there at least 50 times over the years.  Love the food, the good coffee and their location right next to the Union Pacific railroad tracks.  Can eat and watch trains at the same time.  Friendly staff.  Senior discount.  G-gauge train runs around on a track hanging from the ceiling.  Best ham and eggs anywhere.  Have taken many friends and groups there.  Will be going back ASAP.

data.title: Fast Service, Nice Help, Good Food
data.text: We dropped in here Saturday morning because it was close by.  It's kind of a hidden hole in the wall but once you go inside It is apparent this place is well known.  Lots of people eating, but still plenty of room.  We didn't have to wait, ordered food right away and didn't have to wait 30 minutes for it to arrive.  I got "Mark's Mess", sort of a scramble with potatoes, cheese, eggs, etc.  Really good. Mashed potatoes aren't real, but we didn't really expect them to be.  I highly recommend this place and we plan on returning next time we're in the neighborhood.
